channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Escape to the Country
channel.desc: A couple with four children searches for outdoor adventures and fresh air in North Yorkshire, where Briony May Williams helps them find a family home with room to spread their wings.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
channel.desc: A huge 300-year-old mill has become a dumping ground for treasures and valuable heirlooms. A couple need to sell inherited items to fund the restoration of their beautiful home.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
channel.desc: After being brutally double-crossed by fellow Traitor Harry Clark, Paul Gorton is taking a second swipe at his rival. The pair are reunited in the Scottish Highlands, vying to be the winner at auction.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: WA World Athletics Championships
channel.desc: The World Athletics Championships reaches its half way stage, with Noah Lyles and Shericka Jackson returning to defend the titles they won in Budapest 2023 in the heats of the 200m. The women's pole vault final gets underway in Tokyo, with Great Britain's Molly Caudery hoping to make up for her Olympic disappointment in Paris 2024. Meanwhile, the 400m hurdles reach the semi-final stage, the men's long jump final gets underway.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
channel.desc: Without doubt, a huge influence over modern British cuisine are the flavours of the Mediterranean. Brought at first by the Romans and more recently by hordes of holidaymakers returning from the sun, the range of dishes and ingredients we have adopted from the Med are now commonplace on our menus and in our homes. Dave Myers and Si King look at how this has evolved and create their favourite dishes.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: World's Sneakiest Animals
channel.desc: Chris Packham meets the animals using devious tactics and sneaky tricks to survive. New, groundbreaking science reveals astonishing visual trickery, from illusionist zebras to vanishing geckos and shape-shifting cuttlefish.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: The show comes from Hull's City Hall, East Yorkshire. Antique experts Caroline Hawley and David Harper are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction. Caroline uncovers a remarkable collection of suffragette postcards, and David is delighted by some Hull Daily Mail newspaper printing blocks, saved from the tip.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Every day this week, former winners Tim Key, Jamie Laing, Sunetra Sarker and Laura Whitmore take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Portillo's railway adventure along the north and south coasts of the English Channel resumes in Dover, where he recalls the biggest evacuation in military history. Plus, in Margate, Michael admires the Turner Contemporary art gallery.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: SOS: Extreme Rescues
channel.desc: A paraglider with vertigo is stuck in the snow on Crib Goch, emergency teams rush to rescue a dog walker caught by flooding, and a cry for help that could be a person, or a goat.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
channel.desc: The River Irvine in Ayrshire is a hidden gem. From its source close to Loudoun Hill, Paul follows the river through ancient battle fields and discovers a legacy of lacemaking and a treasure trove of gemstones along its banks.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Digging for Britain
channel.desc: Travelling east, Alice discovers a Roman barn conversion, unearths a Tudor fort and finds intricately carved 10,000-year-old weapons.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Wilderness with Simon Reeve
channel.desc: Simon Reeve travels through the wilderness of Patagonia at the foot of the South American continent. Simon's journey takes him up to the huge South Patagonian ice field, through the foothills of the Andes towards the great Grey Glacier of Chile.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
channel.desc: Tir Dhondy retraces Sarm's last known movements before her disappearance from a charter yacht in 2021. She hears Sarm's boyfriend, Ryan Bane, give his account of what happened through his lawyer.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
channel.desc: John Simpson brings his expertise to bear on the most important stories. In discussion with the BBC's range of experts across the world, he uses their unique local knowledge to go beyond the headlines to get to the unspun truth about the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Twiggy
channel.desc: A portrait of International supermodel, actor, singer and iconic British figure, Twiggy.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
channel.desc: It's the semi-final. Three challenges stand between the sewers and the final: plus fours, polo shirts and 1920s-inspired party outfits.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Disaster at Sea: The Piper Alpha Story
channel.desc: With Piper Alpha gone, survivors' evidence becomes key to the truth. The inquiry reveals fatal errors, ignored warnings and failed systems. Will there be justice?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
channel.desc: A crate containing the couples' mobile phones washes ashore, revealing more than anyone bargained for. David drops a bombshell on Ini, causing shockwaves at Couple's Cove. And when night falls, Film Fest serves up some even bigger surprises for the honeymooners.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: MasterChef
channel.desc: Knockout week comes to a head with just ten cooks remaining in the competition. Success could mean a place in the semi-finals, but it will take every ounce of effort to get there.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Homes Under the Hammer
channel.desc: Martel is on home turf in Dundee, and she couldn't be any happier! Dion is looking around a vast house in Merseyside. In Plymouth, Tommy loves the period features on offer.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
channel.desc: Izzie uncovers valuable jewellery, and JJ restores scientific equipment. Money raised at auction will help a man, forced into early retirement, ignite a new passion in his garage.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Gardeners' World
channel.desc: Monty is harvesting sweetcorn. Toby visits a magical garden in Wiltshire. Frances is in a Cornish village to find out how pioneering technology is creating beautiful borders for pollinators. A self-taught grower is transforming her allotment.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: WA World Athletics Championships
channel.desc: Day six gets underway at the Athletics World Championships in Tokyo with a first glimpse of Great Britain's Olympic star Keely Hodgkinson. The 2024 BBC Sports Personality of the Year has struggled through an injury-hit season but is the favourite for gold after running the fastest time in the world in August.

channel.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
channel.desc: Without doubt, a huge influence over modern British cuisine are the flavours of the Mediterranean. Brought at first by the Romans and more recently by hordes of holidaymakers returning from the sun, the range of dishes and ingredients we have adopted from the Med are now commonplace on our menus and in our homes. Dave Myers and Si King look at how this has evolved and create their favourite dishes.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: World's Sneakiest Animals
channel.desc: Chris Packham meets a host of animals that use deceptive tactics to find food. New science reveals that some trick their prey, like the manipulative mantis that looks like a flower and killer whales that set traps using sound. Others cheat each other - sea otters demand ransoms after kidnapping each other's pups.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: In Blackburn, Anita Manning values a gold charm bracelet, and Philip Serrell takes a shine to an unusual globe. Paul Martin finds about the remarkable life of classical singer Kathleen Ferrier.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Every day this week, former winners Tim Key, Jamie Laing, Sunetra Sarker and Laura Whitmore take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Portillo's railway exploration of the Channel coastline and Thames estuary via Calais has reached the Isle of Thanet. Flat and temperate, it's excellent terrain for growing.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
channel.desc: Texan supermodel Jerry Hall and psychotherapist Philippa Perry take to the road in a gigantic 1970s Buick. Squeezing through the narrowest of country lanes, the celebrities are advised and assisted by antique experts Tim Medhurst and Charles Hanson.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saving Lives at Sea
channel.desc: A kayaker has called a mayday after getting into trouble near the Farne Islands, although he is able to communicate his location via his VHF radio, his voice is faltering, and it's a race against time for the Seahouses crew to find him.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Newsreader
channel.desc: Dale embraces his success with a lavish birthday party while Helen struggles to manage her emotions.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Natural World
channel.desc: The story of a giant otter cub, who was rescued and is being raised by Brazilian naturalist Carolina Vargas. Sancho has to be bottle-fed, shown how to catch fish, and taught to outsmart the many predators of the Pantanal, the world's biggest wetland.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
channel.desc: Tir meets with island police and is given CCTV footage that has never been released, showing Sarm's last known movements with her boyfriend, Ryan Bane.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.title: UEFA Champions League Football
channel.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights from the opening match week of the 2025-26 Champions League. Newcastle take on Barcelona at St James' Park in a repeat of their 1997 Group Stage classic, and Manchester City host Italian champions Napoli.

channel.title: The Newsreader
channel.desc: When news of an Alaskan oil spill breaks on the day of Public Eye's launch, Helen is pressured to rethink her show format, whilst combating a brutal act of sabotage from Lindsay. Dale tries to land an interview with the PM.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Freddie Flintoff's Field of Dreams
channel.desc: Freddie is determined to prove his blueprint for changing lives through cricket can work with other groups. In a bid to keep lads from Liverpool engaged, he throws them into their first match.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Global Eye
channel.desc: Bringing forensic journalism from around the world. Nawal Al-Maghafi reports on the crisis in Sudan.

channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Homes Under the Hammer
channel.desc: A stunning Staffordshire build reaches its conclusion. Jacqui is in south east London, where an overgrown garden provides a challenge. In Greater Manchester, work has already started at a mid-terrace.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
channel.desc: A widow needs help to sell her collectibles. JB finds a rare watch that could make a small fortune at auction, and Robin turns to toothpaste to help restore an antique.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Portillo's railway journey reaches the naval port of Brest, home to France's oceanographic fleet. He also learns how to make a sweet, buttery Breton cake called kouign-amann.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Portillo's railway adventure reaches Rennes, capital of Brittany. At the Lycee Emile Zola, he hears how the school was used as a military court for the second trial of Alfred Dreyfus.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: WA World Athletics Championships
channel.desc: Katarina Johnson-Thompson begins the defence of her world title as the women's heptathlon gets underway with the 100m hurdles. It's a busy day for the Olympic silver medallist, with the high jump, shot put and 200 metres all taking place in the single evening session out in Tokyo.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: World's Sneakiest Animals
channel.desc: New science reveals bowerbirds and fiddler crabs using optical illusions to impress a female, whilst a male topi antelope fakes danger to give himself an edge. Meet cross-dressing cuttlefish and marsh harriers as they sneak past dominant males to mate incognito.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: The show comes from Dover Castle in Kent. Jonathan Pratt and James Lewis scour the crowd to find objects to take off to auction. Jonathan discovers an elegant Lalique figure and James finds a pristine collection of Chinese snuff bottles. Paul Martin uncovers the murderous history of Dover Castle.
